description:
This module provides a function (np:node-position) that, given a node, returns positional information about the node in the form of an xs:anyURI item. The module also defines functions that use such positional information to determine: (1) positional relationships between two nodes (e.g. if one is the ancestor of another) and (2) positional properties of a single node (e.g. its level in the tree).

Within this module, the term "node position" will be used to refer to an xs:anyURI item that is returned by the np:node-position function.

functions.name: ancestor-of
functions.signature: ($pos1 as xs:anyURI, $pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is an ancestor of the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is an ancestor of the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is an ancestor of the node position given as first argument.

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is an ancestor of the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: attribute-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is an attribute of the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is an attribute of the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is an attribute of the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential parent node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential attribute node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is an attribute of the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a child of the node position given as first argument.

functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a descendant of the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is a descendant of the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a descendant of the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential ancestor node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential descendant node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is a descendant of the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: following-in-document-order-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is following in document order the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is following in document order the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is following in document order the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential preceding node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential following node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is following in document order the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: following-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is following the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is following the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is following the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential preceding node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential following node position

returns.description: true if node positions $n-pos1 and $n-pos2 belong to the same XML tree and $n-pos2 is following the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a following-sibling of the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is a following-sibling of the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a following-sibling of the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential preceding-sibling node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential following-sibling node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is a following-sibling of the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

functions.name: in-collection
functions.signature: ($n-pos as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description: Determines whether a node position belongs to a collection.
functions.summary: Determines whether a node position belongs to a collection.

parameters.name: n-pos
parameters.description: the node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos belongs to a collection; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: in-same-collection-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether two node positions belong to the same collection.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the two nodes belong to the same collection.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether two node positions belong to the same collection.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: a node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: a node position

returns.description: true if the two nodes whose node positions are $n-pos1 and $n-pos2 belong to the same collection.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: in-same-tree-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether two node positions belong to the same tree.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the two nodes belong to the same tree.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether two node positions belong to the same tree.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: a node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: a node position

returns.description: true if the two nodes whose node positions are $n-pos1 and $n-pos2 belong to the same tree.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: in-subtree-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument belongs to the subtree rooted at the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node belongs to the subtree rooted at the first. Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.

This function differs from np:descendant-of in the way it treats attribute nodes. np:descendant-of follows the XQuery/XPath specification for the descendant axis, and as a result, it does not consider attributes as descendants of any nodes; it will always return false if $n-pos2 was obtained from an attribute node.In contrast, np:in-subtree-of will return true if $n-pos2 was obtained from an attribute node that appeared in the subtree of the node that $n-pos1 was obtained from.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument belongs to the subtree rooted at the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential subtree root node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential node in the subtree node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 belongs to the subtree rooted at the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description: Determines whether a node position corresponds to an attribute node.
functions.summary: Determines whether a node position corresponds to an attribute node.

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos corresponds to an attribute; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: level
functions.signature: ($n-pos as xs:anyURI) as xs:integer external
functions.description:
Computes the level of a node position in its tree.

Note: The root node of a tree is at level one.

The result of the function applies to the corresponding node as well, that is, within the snapshot in which the position was computed, the node level is the returned one.

The result of the function does not imply anything about the node level in other snapshots.
functions.summary: Computes the level of a node position in its tree.

parameters.name: n-pos
parameters.description: the node position of the node whose level should be determined.

returns.description: the level in the tree of the node position $n-pos as xs:integer.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: node-position
functions.signature: ($arg as node()) as xs:anyURI external
functions.description:
Return a URI item containing positional information for a given node.

Within a snapshot, each has a different positional URI. However, different nodes in different snapshots might have the same URI.
functions.summary: Return a URI item containing positional information for a given node.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the node for which the positional information URI should be computed

returns.description: the opaque positional information URI of the node.

functions.name: parent-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is the parent of the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is the parent of the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is the parent of the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential child node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential parent node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is the parent of the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: preceding-in-document-order-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is preceding in document order the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is preceding in document order the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is preceding in document order the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential following node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential preceding node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is preceding in document order the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: preceding-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is preceding the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is preceding the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is preceding the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential following node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential preceding node position

returns.description: true if node positions $n-pos1 and $n-pos2 belong to the same XML tree and $n-pos2 is preceding the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: preceding-sibling-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a preceding-sibling of the node position given as first argument.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is a preceding-sibling of the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a preceding-sibling of the node position given as first argument.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: the potential following-sibling node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: the potential preceding-sibling node position

returns.description: true if the node position $n-pos2 is a preceding-sibling of the node position $n-pos1; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: sibling-of
functions.signature: ($n-pos1 as xs:anyURI, $n-pos2 as xs:anyURI) as xs:boolean external
functions.description:
Determines whether two node positions are siblings.

If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is a sibling of the first.

Otherwise, the result of the function does not imply anything about the positional relationship of the two nodes.
functions.summary: Determines whether two node positions are siblings.

parameters.name: n-pos1
parameters.description: a node position

parameters.name: n-pos2
parameters.description: a node position

returns.description: true if the two node positions $n-pos1 and $n-pos2 are siblings; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZAPI0028 if one of the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the <tt>np:node-position</tt> function.</xqdoc:error>
